description.en:
This course is divided into two sections.
The first section is on semiotics of performance (a detailed description is given under time schedule).
The second section gives an overview of interaction of different semiotic modalities in construction of meaning and of means of semiotic conceptualisation and analysis of their interaction
description.et: Kursus on jaotatud kahte ossa. Esimene osa on pühendatud etenduse semiootilisele käsitlusele (täpsem ülevaade teemadest ajakava all). Teine osa annab ülevaate erinevate semiootiliste modaalsuste rollist tekstilise tähenduse loomisel ja semiootilise kontseptualiseerimise vahenditest ning modaalsuste interaktsiooni analüüsist.

objectives.en: The course gives an overview of different semiotic means of analysis of performative (dance, theatre, rituals, bodily expression etc) and multimedial (cinema, TV, video, commercials, print media, new media etc) texts. The course gives an overview of the central problems, main authors, approaches and methods for analysing performative and multimedial texts, and performativity and multimediality in culture more generally. In seminars various methods are applied in constructing and analysing performative and multimedial texts. Course also contains practical works (small scenes and etudes etc).
objectives.et: Kursuse peamine eesmärk on anda ülevaade performatiivsete (teater, tants, rituaalid, kehaline eneseväljendus jmt) ja multimeedialiste (kino, televisioon, video, reklaam, trükimeedia, uus meedia jne) kultuurinähtuste semiootilise analüüsi erinevatest vahenditest. Tutvustatakse olulisemaid probleeme, tähtsamaid autoreid, teooriaid, käsitlusi ja analüüsimeetodeid. Seminarides proovitakse erinevaid teooriaid rakendada perfomatiivsete ja multimeedialiste tekstide konstrueerimisel ning analüüsimisel. Kursus sisaldab ka praktilisi ülesandeid (nt etüüdid).

notes.et:
The course gives an overview of the nature of semiotic issues in multimedial and performative phenomena in culture and an introduction to different semiotic means of analysis of performative (dance, theatre, rituals, bodily expression etc) and multimedial (cinema, TV, video, commercials, print media, new media etc) texts. The course gives an overview of the central problems, main perspectives, authors, approaches and methods for thinking about and analysing performative / multimedial texts, and performativity and multimediality in culture more generally.
In seminars various perspectives and methods are applied in discussing, constructing and analysing performative and multimedial texts.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in lectures and seminars ( at least 50%), final presentation.
